div.div: With Week 1 of Distance Learning coming to a close, we continue to adapt and learn on how we can best deliver instruction and meet the needs of all students.

a.aria-label: Read more about Digital Tools and Privacy

div.div: DJUSD launches new referral process to support student wellness during Distane Learning.

a.aria-label: Read more about Social Emotional Support and Well-being

div.div: Let's Recognize DJUSD Front Line Alums!
Know a DJUSD alum serving as a first responder, emergency or medical worker or other front line worker during the COVID19 pandemic?

a.aria-label: Read more about Let's Recognize DJUSD Front Line Alums!

div.div: DJUSD Students Begin Distance Learning Instruction Monday, April 13
We look forward to seeing everyone again as we transition to our new remote learning style.

a.aria-label: Read more about DJUSD Students Begin Distance Learning Instruction Monday, April 13

div.div: New: DJUSD Family Guide to Distance Learning
Have questions about our transition to Distance Learning? Review our Family Guide!

a.aria-label: Read more about New: DJUSD Family Guide to Distance Learning

div.alt: schools closed and instruction continues text

div.div: April 3 - DJUSD Campuses Closed Until End of School Year; Instruction Continues Through Distance Learning
Read Superintendent Bowes’ latest message to the DJUSD community for info on school closure and Distance Learning.

a.aria-label: Read more about April 3 - DJUSD Campuses Closed Until End of School Year; Instruction Continues Through Distance Learning

div.alt: image says schools closed for remainder of year and instruction will continue

div.div: April 2 - Superintendent Announces Closure of Schools for Academic Year
Instruction will continue through a Distance Learning Program.

a.aria-label: Read more about April 2 - Superintendent Announces Closure of Schools for Academic Year

div.alt: home learning and distance learning logos

div.div: March 27 - DJUSD IS Preparing for Distance Learning Program- set to launch April 13, If needed
Anticipating that our schools may remain closed for a longer duration, DJUSD has shifted efforts from providing Phase 1 Learning@Home

a.aria-label: Read more about March 27 - DJUSD IS Preparing for Distance Learning Program- set to launch April 13, If needed

div.alt: Board meeting and COVID update text

div.div: April 2 - Board of Education Meeting Tonight + COVID-19 Update
The DJUSD Board of Education will be hosting their first virtual Board Meeting tonight, April 2, at 6:30 p.m..

a.aria-label: Read more about April 2 - Board of Education Meeting Tonight + COVID-19 Update

div.div: We are Monitoring... To Clarify- No Action taken by DJUSD or other Yolo County districts to extend closure beyond May 1, 2020

a.aria-label: Read more about April 1 - Clarifying Extended School Closure

div.div: March 31 - DJUSD Schools Closed Through May 1
Today, in order to continue efforts to reduce the spread of COVID-19 in our community, Superintendent Bowes is announcing that DJUSD schools will remain closed through May 1.

a.aria-label: Read more about March 31 - DJUSD Schools Closed Through May 1

div.div: March 26 - Chromebook Check-Out Extended Until April 3, 2020
Chromebook check-out has been extended so all students can be ready to learn.

a.aria-label: Read more about March 26 - Chromebook Check-Out Extended Until April 3, 2020
View All News
View Full Calendar

div.p: To equip each student with the knowledge, skills, character, and well-being to thrive and contribute to an evolving and increasingly-connected world
